title: Death from amphetamine drug use in England and Wales 1993 to 2018
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Number of deaths, with a total of 26 data points. The chart has 7 significant trends.
The longest trend is extremely positive which exists from 2018 to 2011.
Similarly, the next significant trend is slightly negative which exists from 2011 to 2008.
But, the next significant trend is moderately negative which exists from 2008 to 2005.
Conversely, the next significant trend is moderately negative which exists from 2005 to 2002.
Contrarily, the next significant trend is slightly negative which exists from 2002 to 1999.
Conversely, the next significant trend is extremely positive which exists from 1999 to 1996.
Additionally, the next significant trend is moderately positive which exists from 1996 to 1993.
gold: In 2018 , there were 100 amphetamine-related deaths in England and Wales . Although this is a slight decrease from the preceding year , the number of deaths as a result of amphetamine use has sharply increased in recent years . The number of deaths remained around 50 a year before jumping to 85 mortalities in 2014 .
